private_information: I know the action schema and constraints: paltry requires hand OBJ0 cats OBJ1 texture OBJ2 vase OBJ0 OBJ1 next OBJ1 OBJ2; paltry makes next OBJ0 OBJ2 true and makes vase OBJ0 OBJ1 false.
sip requires hand OBJ0 cats OBJ1 texture OBJ2 next OBJ0 OBJ2 next OBJ1 OBJ2; sip makes vase OBJ0 OBJ1 true and makes next OBJ0 OBJ2 false.
clip requires hand OBJ0 sneeze OBJ1 texture OBJ2 next OBJ1 OBJ2 next OBJ0 OBJ2; clip makes vase OBJ0 OBJ1 true and makes next OBJ0 OBJ2 false.
wretched requires sneeze OBJ0 texture OBJ1 texture OBJ2 stupendous OBJ3 next OBJ0 OBJ1 collect OBJ1 OBJ3 collect OBJ2 OBJ3; wretched makes next OBJ0 OBJ2 true and makes next OBJ0 OBJ1 false.
memory requires cats OBJ0 spring OBJ1 spring OBJ2 next OBJ0 OBJ1; memory makes next OBJ0 OBJ2 true and makes next OBJ0 OBJ1 false.
tightfisted requires hand OBJ0 sneeze OBJ1 texture OBJ2 next OBJ1 OBJ2 vase OBJ0 OBJ1; tightfisted makes next OBJ0 OBJ2 true and makes vase OBJ0 OBJ1 false.

agent1.goal: Analyze applicability of the candidate plan against my initial facts and list required preconditions and unresolved ambiguities. Do not emit PDDL.

private_information: I know the same action schema as agent1 with identical predicates and agent-level naming conventions for actions and objects.

agent2.goal: Analyze my initial facts and the goal, list what actions could achieve the required next relations, and highlight missing links or dependencies. Do not emit PDDL.

private_information: You are the coordinator that must integrate analyses from agent1 and agent2 and produce a combined PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards.

Action schemas available across agents are paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. Predicates include hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, spring, stupendous, collect. Effects are as described by agents and may overlap or conflict; the orchestrator must reconcile them and keep agent actions distinct in the domain.

Two local scenarios are provided by agent1 and agent2 and their goals must be encoded into a single PDDL problem where the goal is the conjunction of the required next relations across scenarios or, if conflicting, document the conflict and prefer achieving all listed target next relations if possible.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a unified PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes the available actions and at least one solvable problem instance combining the agents goals, formatted for the FastDownwards planner.

public_information: There are six action types paltry sip clip wretched memory tightfisted with parameterized object arguments.
Predicates used in the domain include hand OBJ, cats OBJ, texture OBJ, vase OBJ OBJ, next OBJ OBJ, sneeze OBJ, spring OBJ, stupendous OBJ, collect OBJ OBJ.
Each action has preconditions and add and delete effects as documented by agents. Some actions make certain next relations true and other actions delete them or toggle vase facts.
Objects are named object_0 through object_12 across the scenarios.
The orchestrator will combine the agents analyses to produce a PDDL domain and a problem instance for FastDownwards.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an analysis agent. Inspect your private information and the public information. Verify for each step in your candidate plan whether the listed preconditions hold at the time the action is applied according to your initial facts. For each action produce a concise list of required predicates, whether they are currently satisfied, the effects that will follow, and any ambiguities or missing facts that prevent application. Do not emit PDDL or a PDDL domain or problem. Output a structured analysis summary.
analysis.prompt: Your name is agent1. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->agent1->private_information} Your local goal is: {agents->agent1->goal} Perform a step by step analysis of the candidate plan focusing on preconditions, effects, necessary intermediate facts, and unresolved ambiguities. Return a structured analysis as plain text.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an analysis agent. Inspect your private information and the public information. Propose which actions can reach your goal given the initial facts you know. For each candidate action sequence detail preconditions that are missing and any dependencies on other agents. Do not emit PDDL or a PDDL domain or problem. Output a structured analysis summary.
analysis.prompt: Your name is agent2. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->agent2->private_information} Your local goal is: {agents->agent2->goal} Produce a step by step assessment of how to reach your local goal, listing applicable actions, missing preconditions, and points that require coordination. Return a structured analysis as plain text.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert multi-agent PDDL author. Integrate the analyses from the agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem formatted for the FastDownwards planner. Keep actions of different agents distinct as needed and resolve naming mismatches or ambiguous predicates. Encode object declarations for object_0 through object_12. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the produced domain contains well formed types, predicates, and action schemas consistent with STRIPS or ADL features accepted by FastDownwards. If there are irreconcilable conflicts in goals, document them in a short preamble before the PDDL, then still provide a best-effort PDDL instance.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information} Here is agent1 analysis: {analysis_agent1} Here is agent2 analysis: {analysis_agent2} Your task is to integrate these analyses and emit a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that attempts to achieve the combined goals. Keep agent actions distinct and document any assumptions you make. Enclose domain between <domain></domain> and problem between <problem></problem> exactly.
